title: Feminine stencil
content:
I'm looking for examples of stencil type that is less masculine and more neutral or even feminine in appearance.

Any ideas? I thinking more about how the counters are bridged than the actual font itself.  
This is for reference so if you are not quite sure it fits the bill, post anyway and I will no doubt get something out of it.

I know this is based on a preconception of what is masculine etc but nevermind, that's the field on which we play!

Thanks

comments.content:
It's hard without "what for?" but, this is the most feminine stencilI can think of.  
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=242712](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=242712 "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=242712") ?

Cheers!

Good collection of stencil serifs from FontShop:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/stencil\_serif/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/stencil_serif/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/stencil\_serif/")
Thanks for the plug, David. [Auriol](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/auriol_std_complete_vp/) might also be what you're looking for.

Probably not what you are looking for....

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry-west/wild2-keetoowah/gallery.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry-west/wild2-keetoowah/gallery.html)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[_...from the Fontry_](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.thefontry.com/)

Thanks all.

It's for a fashion label, to be laser cut. I will design it from scratch but I am curious to see how/if any others tackled a similar problem. Like I said before, it's less about the base style and maybe more about the way it is converted to a stencil.

One more suggestion — [Typonine Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.typonine.com/fonts/typonine-stencil/), by [Nikola Djurek](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Nikola%20Djurek).

_(Edit-a-Bit: I just noticed that this one is/was featured in the FontCase mentioned before, as well.)_

[Jigsaw Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/jigsaw_stencil), by Johanna Biľak, is one lovely stencil, too.
Thanks David, Typonine caught my eye as having some atypical solutions, which is good because it carries less weight in association.
I immediately think of [Wallflower](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650/http:/typophile.com/node/4933) but I don't know if the creator ever made it available for purchase or use.

Did anyone mention Nyx? Not really feminine, just not square or militaristic

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804023650im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nyx_4611.png)

Thanks again

_Not really feminine, just not square or militaristic_  
Perhaps that's the best I can hope for in terms of avoiding a stereotype.
